text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to share
with you my chili recipe it's very
simple and easy to do I've been using
this recipe for a very very long time
only because it's like my basic go-to I
do make other variations of chili I make
like you know but - Tarryn chili turkey
chili you name it but this is just your
basic and I figured I'd share with you
it's football season make a big pot of
it and on stunt you know what it's a
call football Sunday and you feed an
army with it and it just is delicious
before we get started let's go over the
ingredients that you're gonna need some
sweet Italian sausage without the casing
some ground beef some chopped red bell
pepper onion garlic minced jalapeno that
I've seeded some red kidney beans rinsed
and I've also drained them you can also
need some brown sugar chili powder
ground cumin oregano tomato paste
chopped tomatoes some red wine beef
stock or you can use chicken stock and
you're also gonna need olive oil salt
pepper and that's it so this is like so
classic it so it pretty much really
basic but I really wanted to share it
with you so let's go with your stove and
start cooking I had my big soup pot here
or a medium-high heat with about two
tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil in
there now you can also do this in a
Dutch oven you can do this in any kind
of pot or even in the slow cooker but
I'm gonna do this just in my big pot now
to this I'm gonna add in my meat ground
beef and the sausage I'm just going to
use that one spoon to break it apart
and then I'm just gonna let this cook
until it's about 3/4 of the way cooked
through and then we'll add our veggies
my ground beef mixture is just almost
cooked all the way through so got a
little bit to go now I'm gonna add in
all of my chopped veggies Adam right in
and then of course we need to season it
with a little salt and pepper this also
brings out the moisture out of the
veggies which helps them cook down
faster I'm gonna give it a stir and now
this is gonna cook for about 10 minutes
or medium-high now summer say maybe 8 to
10 minutes or until the veggies start to
cook down and then we'll add a few more
ingredients now to this we're going to
add our brown sugar all of our spices
and the tomato paste just gonna give
this a big big stir just to make sure
all the spices are coating the meat and
veggies well I'm also going to add in my
red wine and this is optional if you
don't drink red wine and you can just
substitute with a little bit more stock
that's perfectly fine just give this a
stir and then it cooked for just a
minute now we're going to add in all of
our remaining ingredients our beef stock
crushed tomatoes make sure you don't
drain them and our red kidney beans that
I have rinsed after I've drained them
now I'm just giving this a nice stir it
looks wonderful now I'm gonna just bring
this up to a boil and then I'm going to
lower the heat to medium low and I'm
gonna let this cook uncovered for about
an hour and a half like I said you could
do this in your slow cooker and you just
put it in the morning it goes for eight
hours on low or three to four hours on
high but I'm just gonna stick this my
back burner it's gonna cook by itself
and my wish then I'm gonna have nothing
to do my Chili's been cooking for about
two hours is so gorgeous it smells
divine and he
so dark I most like a ruby red
gorgeously spiced it does need a bit

always up to you so you can add more of
